definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Sunrooms are the typical combination of windows and doors.
sentences.chinese: 陽光房是一典型的門窗組合結構。

sentences.english: These characteristics are the main reason for the sun room in the high-end market.
sentences.chinese: 這些特點都是別墅陽光房立足中高端市場的重要原因。

sentences.english: Roof garden and solar cells on roof not shown.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂花園和陽光房圖上未展示。

sentences.english: The sunroom has a wall of cabinets and entertainment storage.
sentences.chinese: 陽光房帶有一牆的櫥櫃和娛樂設備儲物空間。

definition: to relax with one's eyes closed
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
variant of 紓壓|纾压[shu1 ya1]
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
(Tw) (slang) to pass time idly/to chill/to hang out
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
Yancheng district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
